catalogue_raissonne: Murase, Art through a Lifetime, no. 29
creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: figure in skirt and scarves at R kneeling and praying to male figure seated on low throne; figure is in brown robes with orange trim; holding white fringed scepter in PR hand at lap; autumn trees in background
inscription:
Inscription

UC: [The Thirty-sixth Wise One / The Elder of Firm Deliverance professed at the Fertile Town. / Diligently seeking the orthodox dharma with no respite; / serving the Buddha in all capacities with thorough trust and devotion. / Purity, solemn sanctity, and firmness of will / all emerge from the mind that clings to nothing.]
medium: Handscroll fragment, mounted as hanging scroll; ink and light color on paper
title: The Thirty-sixth Stage, from Zenzai Dōji’s Fifty-five Pilgrimages, also known as Zenzai Dōji emaki
